It provides guidance for internationalization workflows but does not perform any file operations, network requests, or code execution. All content is educational and poses no security risks.

content.user_title: Automate web app internationalization with complete i18n workflows
content.value_statement: Building multilingual web apps requires complex setup of translation libraries, key management, and locale routing. This skill automates the entire i18n workflow from library installation to translation generation and SEO optimization.
actual_capabilities: Automatically detects framework and selects appropriate i18n library
Generates hierarchical translation keys with namespace organization
Creates locale files for multiple languages with AI or professional translation
Implements RTL support for Arabic, Hebrew, and Persian languages
Configures SEO metadata and hreflang tags for multilingual sites
Builds language switcher components with routing integration
limitations: Requires manual review for cultural nuances and context-specific translations
Framework detection limited to Next.js, React, and Vue applications
AI translations may need professional review for production quality
Complex pluralization rules require manual verification for some languages

best_practices: Use hierarchical key naming like 'landing.hero.title' for better organization and maintainability
Implement lazy loading for translation files to improve initial page load performance
Test RTL languages early in development to catch layout issues before they compound
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding language codes throughout your app - use configuration objects instead
Never concatenate translated strings - use interpolation with variables for dynamic content
Do not skip fallback locale configuration - prevents blank pages if translations are missing

faq.question: Which i18n library should I choose for my framework?
faq.answer: Next.js: next-intl (best app router support). React: react-i18next (most mature). Vue: vue-i18n (official). Each is optimized for its ecosystem.

faq.question: How many languages can I add at once?
faq.answer: No technical limit, but recommend 3-5 for initial launch. Adding more later is straightforward with the skill's architecture.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my existing translation service?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill supports XLIFF/JSON export for professional services like Locize, Crowdin, or Phrase, then imports completed translations.

faq.question: Is my content safe during AI translation?
faq.answer: The skill processes translations locally. No data is sent to external services unless you explicitly configure professional translation APIs.

faq.question: What if translations break my layout?
faq.answer: The skill includes RTL support and responsive design considerations. Test with longest expected translations and use CSS logical properties.

faq.question: How does this compare to Google Translate widget?
faq.answer: Native i18n provides better SEO, performance, and user experience. Google Translate often breaks layouts and can't access dynamic content.
